messaging.details: MSMQ is Windows-only and not compatible with containers. Must migrate to cloud-native messaging service for Azure Container Apps

sessionState.migrationPath: Distributed Cache (Redis, Azure Cache for Redis)
sessionState.details: Currently using Session storage for shopping cart, needs distributed cache for container environments

configuration.details: All configuration needs to be migrated from XML-based config to JSON-based appsettings.json

viewEngine.migrationPath: Razor Pages or ASP.NET Core MVC Views
viewEngine.details: Views need migration to ASP.NET Core Razor syntax, bundles replaced with modern asset pipeline

packageManagement.details: Need to migrate from packages.config to PackageReference format

nugetPackages.name: Newtonsoft.Json
nugetPackages.notes: Can continue using or migrate to System.Text.Json

requirements: Must replace MSMQ with Azure Service Bus
Must use distributed session/cache for shopping cart
Must migrate WCF to REST API or gRPC

estimatedServices.purpose: Distributed session state for shopping cart

frameworkMigration.reason: Complete migration from .NET Framework 4.8.1 to .NET 10, ASP.NET MVC to ASP.NET Core MVC

architectureChanges.reason: WCF to modern API, MSMQ to cloud messaging, session state to distributed cache

codebaseSize.reason: Small codebase (~1,500 lines), 3 projects, manageable scope

dependencies.reason: Multiple legacy dependencies with no direct upgrade path (System.Web, WCF, MSMQ)

businessLogic.reason: Relatively straightforward e-commerce logic, clear separation of concerns

testCoverage.reason: No automated tests present, will need testing strategy for migration validation

containerization.reason: No existing containers, must be created from scratch with cloud-native patterns

complexity.justification: High complexity (8/10) due to the combination of legacy framework patterns requiring complete rewrites (ASP.NET MVC to Core, WCF to modern API, MSMQ to cloud messaging). While the codebase is small and manageable, the architectural changes are substantial. Every layer needs modernization: web framework, service layer, messaging infrastructure, and configuration. The lack of automated tests increases risk. However, the straightforward business logic and small codebase prevent this from being a 9-10 complexity project.

phases.name: Foundation & Setup
phases.description: Create new .NET 10 project structure and set up containerization
tasks: Create new ASP.NET Core MVC project targeting .NET 10
Set up Azure Service Bus for messaging
Configure Azure Cache for Redis for session state

phases.name: Data Layer & Models
phases.description: Migrate data models and repository pattern
tasks: Update models to be compatible with modern serialization

phases.name: Service Layer Modernization
tasks: Create ASP.NET Core Web API controllers
Migrate IProductService operations to REST endpoints
Update web app to call REST API instead of WCF

phases.name: Messaging Infrastructure
phases.description: Replace MSMQ with Azure Service Bus
tasks: Implement Azure Service Bus queue sender in web app
Create new order processor using Azure Service Bus receiver

phases.name: Web Application Migration
phases.description: Migrate ASP.NET MVC to ASP.NET Core MVC
tasks: Update Razor views for ASP.NET Core
Replace bundling with modern asset pipeline
Implement distributed cache for session state
Migrate configuration from Web.config to appsettings.json

phases.name: Containerization
phases.description: Complete Docker setup and test containers

risks.mitigation: Use CoreWCF for compatibility or design clean REST API

risks.risk: MSMQ to Service Bus behavioral differences
risks.mitigation: Thorough testing of message handling and failure scenarios
Implement Redis-backed session state early in migration
Create integration tests during migration to validate behavior

risks.risk: Container image size and startup time
risks.mitigation: Use multi-stage builds and optimize layers

Set up Azure Service Bus namespace for development
Review and document all business logic before migration
Create integration test suite to validate migration

Use Azure SDK for .NET for Service Bus integration
Use Docker Desktop for local container testing
Consider using Dapr for messaging abstraction (optional)
architecture: Replace WCF with RESTful API (simpler than gRPC for this use case)
Use Azure Service Bus queues for order processing
Implement distributed session with Azure Cache for Redis
Follow ASP.NET Core best practices for dependency injection
Implement health checks for Container Apps

deployment: Use Azure Container Apps for both web and order processor
Use Azure Key Vault for secrets management
Enable auto-scaling based on HTTP requests and queue depth
Set up Application Insights for monitoring

successCriteria: All functionality works identically to current application
Application runs in Linux containers on Azure Container Apps
Order processing uses Azure Service Bus instead of MSMQ
Shopping cart maintains state across container restarts
Response times are equal or better than current application
